intro: Patellaria, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Patellaria species are usually short-lived and have a compact growth habit. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or horticulture.
